sentences.sContent: We have to stop her pinching her baby brother.
sentences.sCn: 我们不能让她再掐她小弟弟了。

sentences.sContent: Put all the ingredients, including a pinch of salt, into a food processor.
sentences.sCn: 将所有的配料，连同一撮盐，放进食品加工机里。

synos.tran: 捏；勒索；使苦恼；掐掉某物，修剪

phrases.pCn: [化]夹点（饱和蒸气与冷却剂最小温差点）

remMethod.val: p ＋ inch(英寸) → 以英寸计量的 → (一)撮， 微量

words.tran: 压紧的；痛苦的；困难的；收缩的

trans.tranOther: to press a part of someone’s skin very tightly between your finger and thumb, especially so that it hurts
A pinch of an ingredient such as salt is the amount of it that you can hold between your thumb and your first finger
